timeline.message:
Refactored TableSegment, TableEntry, TableKey in preparation for creating KeyValueTable. Moved a few classes around.

Refactored SegmentHelper to make use of TableSegmentKey, TableSegmentEntry and TableSegmentKeyVersion which better map to what a Table Segment can do. Refactored upstream code and adjusted unit tests.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@dell.com>

Javadoc.
Moved IteratorItem into its own file.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@dell.com>

Javadoc.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>

Made IteratorState a class.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>

TableSegmentImpl.
TableSegmentIterator.
Fixed a bug in MockConnectionFactoryImpl that was closing an externally-provided Executor when it shouldn't be.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>

Updated TableSegment.keyIterator and TableSegment.entryIterator.

timeline.bodyText: By default this results in only retrying for ~10s. Is this intended?
timeline.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText:
The maximum retry wait is 10s (10ms * 2^10). But it will try 10ms, 20ms, 40ms, ...., 1s, 2.5s, 5s, 10s.
That still looks too frequent. I changed the multiplier to 4; that should stagger it a bit.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.bodyText:
These two operations being non-atomic leads to a bazar possibility of passing the closed check at the top and getting an NPE on 46 if calling getNext from multiple threads concurrently.
I am also not sure it makes sense to call getNext concurrently. It seems like the fetchNext function should not be invoked multiple times in parallel. (Though multiple times before the futures return does make sense)
timeline.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText:
This implements AsyncIterator which provides an asSequential wrapper (built-in) that guarantees getNext cannot be executed concurrently (if invoked concurrently, the executions will be serialized).
So no worries here.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText:
I don't understand. What do you mean by primitive?
Do you mean the special values for NOT_EXISTS and NO_VERSION? Those are drawn from WireCommands.TableKey.NOT_EXISTS/NO_VERSION, which are sync-ed with the server-side values.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.message:
Changed backoff multiplier.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>

Table Segment Iterators are now sequential.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>
